Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Zelda48
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased that we had booked this Hotel for our stay in Barcelona. It's an older style Hotel but with modern rooms. The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful and had good English. The room we had was at the back of the Hotel away from the other rooms so it was very quiet. The room was very big as was the Bathroom and it was very clean. My only criticism was the bed was too hard. I noticed that some of the rooms wer quite small and cramped so we were lucky with our room. The location is perfect a 5 minute walk to the Aerobus terminal with buses running every 10 minutes to the Airport. There are plenty of places to eat within a few minutes of the Hotel and wonderful Tapas bars. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: JackieA58
Reviews.Content: Spent a four day pre Easter break at this hotel and truly couldn't fault anything. Reception staff were always chatty and friendly, the room was in good decorative order, very clean, and comfortable, and we certainly didn't have to pay to watch TV?!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It has a superb central location too.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service were great”
Reviews.Author: Shelley H
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for an overnight in Barcelona with my husband, our 2 kids and my father-in law. The boys had FC tickets so I wanted a central location where my daughter and I could entertain ourselves while they headed to the game. My one concern was reception, after reading some of the reviews. My expectations were set very low so I was quite taken aback at the exceptional service we received on arrival. The gentleman on reception could not have been friendlier or more helpful. His night replacement was equally as friendly. I signed up for the wireless for an hour at night and had no issues. The value point for wifi was 8 hrs for 5 euro, but there was no chance of me staying awake. The location was just fantastic. There were a few issues with the rooms - the doors are really hard to close so people tend to slam them. So when you're in your room you can hear people banging doors regularly. The elevator was loud and I was surprised they didn't constrain its hours of use. While the rooms themselves were spacious, clean and quite nice the stay was a bit hindered by above mentioned noise. It never woke us but was noticeable when trying to nod off. That being said, you just can't beat the price to location ratio of this hotel. I would recommend it for charm, location, service, function and value. After all, you don't stay in the heart of Barcelona for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nouvel Hotel, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Sheela H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Nouvel hotel the week leading up to Easter 2012 as a single traveller. The staff are very friendly and welcoming and the hotel is centrally located just off Las Rambas and easily accessible for sight-seeing. My room was at the back of the hotel so it was relatively quiet at night. My room is a bit dated and could really do with a fresh coat of paint plus it smelt quite musty. The bed and pillow were extremely uncomfortable. Wi-Fi costs 2 euors per hour and has to be used continuously during the hour or one loses internet connection. I couldn't reconnect unless I paid again. Also, if you wish to to watch TV, a 20 euro deposit is required for the TV control for the duration of your stay. Whilst the hotel centrally located and looks attractive from the front, I would not rate it as a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel, hopeless receptionist”
Reviews.Author: KWD_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, being close to the terminal for the airport coach, and within easy reach of all the tourist attractions. The building is very attractive, and the bedrooms are OK although rather minimalist. However, we had an interior room which, even with the heating turned off, was always too hot – in mid March. The air conditioning was not functioning, so we had to keep the window open, and the sound of voices from other rooms boomed throughout the enclosed interior well. So my advice is to request an outside room. I have to add that the receptionist was absolutely hopeless. On our arrival, she denied that we had a booking despite the fact that I presented her with written confirmation of our booking for which we had already paid in full. She was very dismissive and unhelpful, and refused to do anything to resolve the confusion. Eventually, after we failed to go away, she offered us a room for the night on the condition that we would pay for it if the matter could not be resolved by the manager the next day. The following day, following this outrageous treatment, the manager appeared, resolved the matter immediately, and apologised for the mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona break”
Reviews.Author: Sue C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly and efficient and the person on the desk spoke English. We did not sample the cuisine. The room was delightful though the beds were hard.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied - GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: JMRDICK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in heart of city on a narrow, "no vehicle" street. We parked our car at "Forum" parking lot (easy to find, safe, secure and attended) for €36 for up to 5 days. We then took Tram 4 to "Glories" or "Marina" Metro and took Line 1 to Catalunya station. It is an easy walk from Catalunya to Nouvel Hotel. (Forum parking to hotel approx. 25 minutes) The staff were very friendly and imformative. Breakfast is available at hotel but we chose to go to any one of dozens of cafe's in immediate area. The hotel is a traditional older building that has been well maintained. Room was good size with large ensuite. Don't expect a good view. It's downtown and surronded by other buidings. Tours are available at Catalunya (5 minute walk), La Rambla is 2 minutes at street corner from hotel. You can't beat this location at excellent price/value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location, hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: janice-g-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from 4 nights in Barcelona. We chose this hotel based on its price and location. Both are hard to beat - it is really a great value hotel, clean, friendly, good size rooms and superb location. As other reviewers have said it is so easy to get to using the Aerobus from the airport and getting off at Pl Catalunya. And from there it is an easy 5 minute walk. You are surrounded by lots of cafes, bars, restaurants and clothes shops. The open top tourist buses go from Pl Catalunya every 10 minutes or so. It is a nice walk down to the harbour with more nice shops and restaurants. The market which is off La Rambla is great - fruit, veg, fish, chocolates, dried fruit and nuts of every description and some lovely places to eat as well. We went to a fish bar at the back of the market which gets very busy and you have to stand and wait for a stool to perch on but it is well worth it for the lovely fresh fish and shell fish they cook to order. We can't wait to go back to this hotel, which for us was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Old Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: southbank10
Reviews.Content: Perfectly placed to the La Rambla & Pl Catalunya! Easy to get to as in literally a 5 minute walk MAX from the Aerobus stop. A charming hotel with fantastic decor. Vert friendly staff. The room was Ok, decent size & beds with a lovely on suite! You are not paying for 5 star luxury so please don't expect that. As a base to see the best of Barcelona this is a great hotel. Local restaurants surprisingly decent and the cafe opposite does a great breakfast & espresso! For once what you see is what you get at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maryj087
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in February and booked through Aer Lingus. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is minutes from the Aerobus stop, and seconds from Las Rambla and if you turn the other way when you walk out the front door you will comet to a lovely pedestrianised street hich is excellent for shopping and will bring you down to the Gothic Quarter. The hotel is very nice, it is not new, and the rooms are very high. We stayed for four nights, and spent our first night in a room which seemed to have an interior view, and the bathroom was behind sliding glass doors - not very private at all! When we asked to change there was no problem, and the next room had a view to Carrer St Anna, and two balconies - which were lovely. It also had a better bathroom - completely seperate from the room and very spacious. There was plenty of space for our luggage, and plenty of wardrobe space. The rooms were very warm, and the weather was quite cold! I found the beds to be comrortable, although I didn't like the pillows. Yes, we paid for the safe, it cost €1.50 a day, which is not exorbitant, and we struggled by without a remote control. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the hotel oozes character.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cazzzie987
Reviews.Content: We got a taxi to this hotel at 40 euros on the way there and 46 euros on the way back, mainly to do with travelling back on a Sunday. The bus is jus over 5 euros if you are just travelling as a couple then I would recommend it, however with 6 of us the taxi worked out roughly the same as bus. When we got to the hotel check in was pretty easy, but seemed to take a while. The staff were okay, didn't really say much. The room was clean, basic and just what you need. The bathroom is nice, doesn't quite fit with the bedroom as its much more modern and done up. I liked the wardrobe space and there were bed side cabinets as well for extra space. Our room for two people was really for 4 with a sofa bed and an extra single bed. There is a balcony in some rooms, and found looking at my friends rooms they were all similar, some with better views. The really good thing about this hotel is it is right in the centre of the city near shops and restaurants, so quite good value, about a 15 minute walk to the marina and aquarium. The ice bar was quite a trek so we got a taxi for 20 euros. The only bad points were the room was quite cold the first night and wouldn't walk up and the beds are rough hard. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, instead choose to eat at a cafe right near the hotel which was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevieBedfordUk
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day trip to Barcelona was excellent. We booked the Nouvel thro' Travel Republic without hassle and at a good rate. The location could not be more central and within a 5 minute walk from Placa Cataluya/Aerobus stop from the airport. Other reviewers complain about the hard beds but in all our stays in Spain (30 years+) they are not the best but what the hell! We all survived? If you are quoted for breakfast don't bother. It is mediocre and there are lots of cafes -even in Carrer Santa Anna The staff are great and very helpful. PS you don't need a TV remote unless you are lazy. Controls are on the TV!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, but brand new room”
Reviews.Author: nudechef
Reviews.Content: Its an old hotel, but the room looks brand new. I had the room with a terrace(unfortunately with no view). The bathroom was strangely huge(bigger than the bedroom). Bed was a bit hard. And I hate that you have to put deposits for the TVs remote control Excellent location, 1 minute walk to Las Ramblas and 5 minutes to the airport shuttle bus. Everything is close-by. Staff was extremely nice and helpful. One staff brings a couple of her boys and we had a lot of fun playing with them. Its on a small street so taxis cannot drop you in front of the hotel. Price was expensive, but I stayed on New year's eve should that might be reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 3* in heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mostly_oil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but that means the rooms have high ceilings. We had a triple family room which was intelligently laid out. The street view meant we also had a couple of balconies too! Room was clean and neat. Heating was good as was sound-proofing - not bullet proof but effective. Service was efficient and good. Didn't try the breakfast as there are plenty of local places; €10 per head seemed a bit steep. Charged for the use of the safe deposit box which was new to me! Apart from that, highly recommended for a clean, neat 3* hotel with character in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Charges Irritating”
Reviews.Author: Mary J
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the room was clean but so cramped. I traveled solo and paid for a double room. I thought they gave me a single room in error but was told it was indeed a room for two people. I tried the breakfast the first day and it was not worth it. The most irritating was the "nickeling and diming" of basic items ie. Wifi, safe, TV remote (20 Euros deposit!). At least, they did not charge for the toilet paper! The hotel is very old and a needs major upgrade. Stay only if you get a good rate and you need to be close to Plaza Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly and helpful staff- Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: rajiv25
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best location you can get at a great price, at the city centre, everything is buzzing, you are at a 2 minute walking distance from the shops and most importantly the sightseeing hop on hop off buses! The retail therapy experience is out of this world! Get the Aerobus from the airport and it stops 2 minutes walk from the hotel! Ultra convenient! Do not miss this hotel at a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Mark J
Reviews.Content: Returned to this Hotel after previous visit in 2009. Hotel is in great location close to Ramblas and public transport to and from Airport. Have to say we were disappointed on our second visit. Had booked double room but upon arrival initially given twin room. Eventually given double room. Room was very small and beds not very comfortable. Hotel is also very noisy. Found some staff to be indifferent to issues we raised. Overall superb location but would not stay in this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQTravelerDenver
Reviews.Content: The reviews we ready about this hotel in Trip Advisor helped us pick this hotel and the reviews were right. The hotel was a 2-minute walk from Playa Catalunya just a half block off La Rambla. Plenty of restaurants and fund things to see and do all within a 5-minute walk. The room was more than satisfactory--the bathroom was gorgeous. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel does have a restaurant and it looked very nice but we did not eat there. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but ......”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPoloFounex
Reviews.Content: Excellent location? Yes, but the beds are uncomfortable, the rooms are very small, the breakfast is not worth it, and there are additional charges for the wi-fi, and the safe (although showering does not cost you a cent!). In all disappointing.......... There are other hotels, just as conveniently located, that charge the same but are better (e.g. the Turin hotel, just across the Ramblas).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kamptz
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel just off La Rambla and close to the airport bus at Catalunya square. Nice room and very nice bathroom, the only problem as far as we were concerned was that the bed was too hard (typical Spain?)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: tshah1n
Reviews.Content: Just off la ramble street and close to Catalunya square. Location is excellent for travelers. Hotel room are clean and spacious yet missing a mini bar. Breakfast was ok. Highly recommended for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central.”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie050
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Las Ramblas and the central square in Barcelona.Although the rooms are a little dark and the breakfast lacks imagination,the fact that the staff are friendly and helpful make up for this.It is spotlessly clean and you could not be more central.I have stayed here on two occasions and would highly recommend it for a short break or if taking a cruise from the port of Barcelona,it is only a short taxi ride away.Taxis can be found at the end of the street,less than one minute away.If seeking a good nights sleep but you want to be near the action, this is the hotel for you, Would stay here again. Stairs a bit on the steep side and the lift could be classed as antique,so would not be suitable for less able bodied. l

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anchorfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a small pedestrian street off La Rambla - the famous street through the centre of Barcelona. It is quiet but central and for anyone wanting a small, well run, pleasant hotel near the centre this is ideal. Perhaps 3 1/2 stars would be a better description as it is more than average but not a grand hotel. We would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SouthYorks
Reviews.Content: My wife, 15 year old son and I travelled to Barcelona with the intent of packing as much into a 5 night stay as we possibly could. We therefore wanted to stay in a central location to allow easy access to all the main attractions. We investigated several options for hotels but decided to stay in the Nouvel Hotel following positive reviews. The hotel is officially rated as 3 star, and to be honest this is an accurate representation. Anyone who reviews this hotel as 5 star is mis-representing the hotel since 5 star luxury is not what this hotel is about. Don’t get me wrong, the hotel is exactly as I would expect for a 3 star rating, so these comments are not intended to be negative. The Nouvel Hotel is clean, relatively basic, and functional, but its greatest asset is its location just off La Rambla (almost at the top near to Placa Catalunya) on Calle de Santa Anna. Anyone wanting easy access to the city either on foot, via the tourist buses or the Metro is ideally located at this hotel with the tourist (and airport) buses and the Metro operating from Placa Catalunya. La Rambla provides plenty of amusement with the various street entertainers, artists, illegal street hawkers (and police regularly chasing them) and with a vast array of superb restaurants. In the hotel we had a triple room, which was on the 3rd floor and luckily over-looked the (mainly) pedestrianised street, so had plenty of space and 3 small balconies. As others have commented, the beds were somewhat firm but bedding was clean, as was the bathroom which had a good shower. As you would expect from a city centre hotel it wasn’t all peace and quiet, but when using the hotel as a base to see the sights this isn’t the main criteria for selecting a hotel, so expect to hear a little street noise in the morning (workers travelling and shops opening) and late evenings (daily garbage clearance). The staff were all friendly and helpful, particularly the reception staff. The breakfasts were fairly basic (being an English man abroad I still can’t along with cold meats and cheese for breakfast), so next time we would stay room-only and use the local patisserie which was located directly across the street from the hotel. Overall we would recommend this hotel as an excellent base from which to explore the city and we are already planning a return visit to Barcelona in 2012 and will definitely be looking to stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, authentic, excellent location, luxury for a low price!”
Reviews.Author: Iona T
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first trip to Barcelona! I stayed in this hotel with my family, and I could not believe how upmarket it looked! It is one of the oldest hotels in the city so the decor is beautiful - a sort of 20s, glamourous feel. The rooms are large and the en-suites modern and well equipped (ours had a bath which was great) and the location could not be better. The staff are all friendly and extremely helpful. We had breakfast, and it was honestly the best continental breakfast I have ever experienced from a hotel. The crossants, cheese, yoghurt, cakes, cereal, tea, coffee, and everything else were delicious. There is also a living room type thing at the front of the hotel where you can relax after you have checked out before you leave for the airport. Overall, a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Renfrewbud
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic weekend in Barcelona and one of the highlights was this wonderful hotel. Wanted somewhere quite central but was a bit concerned that it would be a noisy being so near La Rambla but that couldn't have been further from the truth as it was an oasis of peace and quiet. The room was quite spacious with a beautiful modern bathroom. The staff were very helpful and their knowledge of Barcelona was excellent. Breakfast was also excellent with a good variety of food on offer. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn't stay anywhere else when I return to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Rude employees, stale-smelling rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travel G
Reviews.Content: This definitely ranked as THE worst hotel experience I had in Spain. Trust me on this one: save your money and stay elsewhere. The front desk staff was extremely rude and unhelpful. My room was cramped, cold and had an unpleasant, stale odor (probably due to lack of ventilation as the only window opened on to three other walls of the hotel). There wasn't much sound-proofing either so it made it very difficult to get much sleep. In the morning the elevator was broken and the staff made no offer to help transport luggage down three steep flights of stairs. The breakfast featured orange juice that tasted suspiciously like Tang and watery eggs and beans. The hotel had been arranged for me by a travel agent and I sorely wish I'd made my own arrangements and gone elsewhere. Overall it was definitely NOT worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: clumsygoofy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for about four days and were generally happy with our stay. The bathroom wad state of the art and the room was clean. The reception as well as other staff were generally helpful and knowledgable. The location was excellent as it was just off la ramblas, so we git to be very close to the action while not being completly in the midst of all the hustle and bustle. Was close to all the shopping as well. Another good point wad that it was a few mins walk from the drop off and pick up point for the areobus which worked out really well for us. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Damon H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay. Very clean, great receptionist and valuable information was provided by the staff. Out the door and you're right into the shopping district. Spent 4 hours on the "Barcelona Bus Tour". Had a great time seeing the sights. Visited the Picaso Museum. It's a must see if you love art. More than 50 pieces. Stayed one night before going on a cruise and 2 nights after we returned. Would stay again if we go back to Barcelona. Living in Jacksonville, FL.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Experience in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bessemer70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a group of our friends booked a pre-cruise stay in Barcelona, Spain, from Sept. 2-4, 2011. When our travel agent suggested a very expensive, 4-star hotel for those two days, we decided to try out luck (with a bit of guidance from another friend who had been in Barcelona the previous March) on the Internet. We knew the general vicinity where we wanted to be, and as luck would have it, our search yielded the Hotel Nouvel on Santa Anna. We couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel. It is located just a half block off Las Ramblas, the main shopping and eating avenue in Barcelona, and about a block from Placa Catalunya, the hub of the city. From the minute we arrived, the manager, Roberto, was so welcoming and helpful. The hotel is small with just 78 rooms, but the street it is on is very quiet considering it is so close to Las Ramblas, which is bustling with people at all hours of the day. If you are looking for great views, don't expect them here. Since we knew we'd be getting all the scenery we'd want on the cruise, we just wanted a quiet, clean place to sleep for those two nights. We absolutely loved this place. The decor gives an Old World feel while being thoroughly modernized. We definitely want to return to Barcelona someday to see more of what we just had a two-day taste of, and when we do, Hotel Nouvel will be our choice of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: musthavetravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what I wrote above. Its seconds from Las ramblas (if u desire that) and close to everything, rooms are clean, workers are attentive. The beds are hard, but the bathroom is clean and modern with an awesome shower (makes up for the bed and u kinda get used to it after the first night). Rooms are small and are not conducive to spending a lot of time in which was ok for us BC we wanted to explore a lot. Overall it's a fine hotel- we're not big on air conditioning so the reviews of it being spotty were ok and we were out all day so the lack of view didn't matter. In the busy travel months this hotel is good but if u dont plan last minute like we did u could probably get something a little more modern and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mslondon70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. It was my boyfriend's choice i would of chose one of the more modern hotels. But have to say i was pleasantly surpised. The room itself was clean, if a little dull and dreary, but its an old fashioned hotel so i guess thats why. The beds were alittle too hard but for a 3 night stay it surficed.We had a terrace which didnt look out onto anything interesting. the only thing the room lacked was a mini fridge which would come in handy in the summer months. Best thing about the hotel is the Location...seconds away from the La Ramblas. Everyting is within walking distance. Beach and harbour 20-30min walk away. Like other people have suggested get the Eurobus to and from the airport, 5 Euros each way per person, takes the same amount of time as a taxi and loads cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean.”
Reviews.Author: mackem73
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, room was very clean and good bathroom. safe was 2 euro a night extra but thats fine. breakfast was good, plenty of options, most staff were very helpful and spoke good english, one older guy was very stroppy though and not willing to help, so if you want help, go to reception when he is not on. I would stay again but avoid that one guy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrancisFord
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. Easy travel from the airport as aerobus stops 2 blocks away. Easy metro access as well (we took the train out). Minutes from La Rambla and many pubs and restaurants. Beds are very hard and A/C was working hard to cool. I'd sweat at night which is kind of gross in a hotel. Rooms are clean but floors always seemed dirty. I'd stay here again but only if I couldn't find something better. There are dozens of hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and very good value.”
Reviews.Author: orthorexia
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be helpful and courteous, and reception had good command of English. A key each was extremely helpful and unusual. Good bedroom (despite no real usable window) and bathroom. Loved decor, especially ground floor and writing room with all the desks. Breakfast not up to much but suffecient to our taste to give the day a reasonable start. Cheese toasted nicely. We will be going again. Better Meals at less cost 5mins walk away from Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: 181colorado
Reviews.Content: Good location, {close to plaza, las ramblas and metro} priced well, very clean and staff were wonderful. Was a little apprehensive based some reviews, and very pleased to find it was charming and that the beds were fine. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sarahaaron
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for a Barcelona weekend break, and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel. The hotel itself is quite small, but the room we were given was very spacious, nicely decorated and had a balcony. The room was very clean and had good air conditioning and linens. The only downside to the hotel was the breakfast, which had a poor selection of hot food, although what was there seemed ok. The hotel is in a very central location, on a side street off Las Ramblas - the perfect location in fact, and within easy walking distance to the harbour and gothic quarter too. I would rate this hotel highly among other city break hotels I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, clean, friendly and located in a lovely street off the ramblas x”
Reviews.Author: Emmak90
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were so pleased with this hotel. It is situated in a lovely little street right off La Rambla, with little shops and bakeries just outside the hotel. Inside it is well furnished and clean, and we found the staff to be very helpful. On arrival the male receptionist handed us a few maps and cards for local tapas bars, gave us some helpful advice about pick-pocketing and stored our luggage away until our room was ready. There is a lift in the hotel too that comes in handy after a long days walking around or for those with disabilities. The room was lovely, quite small, but just what you need for a good night's rest. There was a safe in the room which was great for 1.50 a day and also a lovely little shower room, with complementary toiletries. I think the best things about this hotel are the location and the cleanliness of the rooms. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “In two minds”
Reviews.Author: Beans67
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated just off the top of La Rambla. The old man on reception was arrogant throwing his head up in the air when I asked about the number for the in room safe. The lady and night porter were very nice and helpful. We stayed for three nights in a three bed room. Was very reminiscent of the film Rear window as we had a nice little balcony on the fourth floor overlooking private residencies and could sit and watch the everyday goings on of the locals.The first morning our room was clean but the other two nights clean towels were just dumped on the dressing table. I even had to go and ask for extra toilet rolls at reception. Breakfast was continental but very nice with good choice with the best coffee I have ever tasted. Would I stay again? If I had the same room yes. I know some of my friends who were also staying commented on how our room was better than theirs. The only thing that does deter me from returning is the arrogance of the Spanish people. A horrible race. If you want the beach though it is a good half hour walk and the taxis all take different routes!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient, in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: John2a
Reviews.Content: The Nouvel is a character place with a nice entrance off a narrow old-city side street. It's superbly located - only 30 seconds off the La Rambla action, and about 90 secs to the main square. I was surprised by the size and quality of the room, given this is 3 star - -huge modern bathroom, roof terrace, fairish room space. Suspect we got lucky, but I didn't hear any other guiests complaining. I don't remember the room number but try requestig "top floor with a terrace." The front desk staff are friendly, skilled, and pleased to give you their time. Do the Gaudi bus tour they push, partly because it takes you straight past all the queues. The great Picasso museum is also nearby, and the Palau de Musica Catalan is well worth visitng - we hadn't booked a show but got lucky (again) becase a symphony orchestra was in rehearsal while we looked at the magnificant main chamber. The Nouvel's breakfast is dreary, but hey, it's free, and several places near the front door do great coffee

Reviews.Title: “GOOD AREA,OK HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: jardden
Reviews.Content: on the very small side street "carrer anna"from les rambles,las ramblas... joined by another small street"carrer canuda"....its also bound by avda portal de angel with a corte ingles department store at the end of the street...from the ramblas you could easily pass these two side streets,without blinking if you were not looking and you can not get a taxi or a bus to either santa anna or carrer canuda as they are pedestrains only...get one from ...ave port de angel and las ramblas...less than a few meters left and right... this is a perfect location for all amenites and very much in the centre with placa de catalunya and all shops and restaruants very close by....but of course at certain times like 22.00-0300 in the morning quite busy and still in the centre of the city...much noise... if your looking for the cathederal santa anna as a landmark,you would miss that too as its down a seperate street,...behind gates... the rambla is very busy 24/7 very dangerous for pickpockets ,keep your bags close to you and wear your money underneath your clothes or in your shoes at all times...and dont place your camera bags,suitecases even for a second,out of your site...also watch out for hookers in the early hours...who will come out of no where and and molest single males.... the hotel is rather small,and the single rooms.too are very very small but clean and generally comfortable..wth average person finding it difficult to pass in the bathroom....and the bath is small ,the shower to needs updating as does the decor....taps and showers may be difficult to use ,as become stuck and my toilet needed urgent repairs....the reception did promtly fix my shower problem and also answer all my enquires....very fast... the reception also was very polite and give all information about the area,leaflets....but the decor needs updating in parts..taps,toiltets,showers...it has only one lift....and could do with another at peak times.,that means you may have too walk 4 floors ,if the lift is too busy with luggage/baggage ..also in the early hours,0.00-0500am this hotel being in the city centre..."barri gottico" cituat vella...can be noisy depending on the room facing the street balconies or at the side..and the neighbours can be heard ,if their loud or banging doors...sometimes with paper thin walls... in the summer months too the air con, needs urgent updating...only just about cooling the room...do not open the balcony doors ,as will automaticaly stop... dont be suprised in this hotel that you will have to deposit 20euros for a tv remote...you will have this refuned on check out... this hotel will provide information,is polite and generally clean in a central area... 8/10 for the area...more like a 2 star 7/10 for hotel decor and 10/10 for customer services...and polite helpful staff.. ..this hotel is perfect...for its very close walking distance to the placa de catalunya...where you can get the aerobus into and from airport for less than 10euros..and the bus touristic...citysightseeing.com...this is a better service than the barcelona bus....and you can hop on and off over 48hrs for 30euros.... the santa anna resturant on santa anna street ,meteres from hotel nouvelle,is both reasonable for tourists and locals ,as frequented by both...always busy...and good food...good service...local sidra,brut and paella...10/10....also for breakfast buffet close by on the les rambles,las ramblass is the la poma rest...directly across from las ramblas...9/10 for 12 euros.. you can get souvenirs,newpapers,magazines and tourist tat all the way up and down the ramblas...and underneath placa de catalunya is the tourist info...purchase your touristic tickets and aerobus here too...

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Las Ramblas, but, far enough..”
Reviews.Author: Nonnita02
Reviews.Content: With my daughter we stayed at this hotel, selected at random in Barcelona. I chose it because it is near Las Ramblas and easy to get around. Perfect location, we walked everywhere. Las Ramblas is at the corner, and the most important area (for us) the Barrio Gotico as well. The building is very pretty, impresive inside more than outside. The room spacious, and comfortable. The staff superb. A pleasure to deal with them every day, as we stayed for 2 weeks. They gave us maps and tips to get around. Breakfast was included and could use a little improvement, as after a few days it becomes boring. Not even on Sunday they had something a little different. But there is plenty to eat. I would have liked more fresh fruit, the pears didn't look attractive at all. However, all in all we had a nice stay and would go back to the same place. This hotel is rated 3 stars,but, I have my doubts about that compared to the one we stayed at in Tossa de Mar. I was surprised to see that Catalan is the first language spoken in the city, but, we managed

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, next time I will be back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerrheydt
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Estacion Franca, it costs about 7 Euros and takes 10 minutes to go the hotel, situated in a small street, very quiet, about 50m from Las Ramblas. You will always find someone at the reception desk who talks french or english, and of course spanish. The rooms are quite spacious, and comfortable. As read in some reviews, it can be loud during the night, but this is not the problem of the rooms, but, in my case, the high-heeled, drunken english women trying to do a flamenco on the marble floor just in front of my door, at about 3 o'clock in the morning. If you do not like a big breakfeast, better go 20 m, in the direction of Las Ramblas, and you will find a "panaderia", where you can have an orange juice, a croissant, and a coffee or tea for 3.50 Euros, instead of 12 for a complete breakfast at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great central location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BigR51
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Catalunya square and one block off the Ramblas but on a quiet narrow street made Hotel Nouvel a perfect place for my wife and I during our first trip to Barcelona. Great location for walking and catching buses. Room was nice, clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “There are bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: cocici
Reviews.Content: there are bed bugs and they admit that , Rooms are small and not clean. Breakfast is poor. aircondition is not working even we change the rooms. Well location is good if you looking for that only

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy030031
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is perfect, but if arriving into Barcelona Airport PLEASE don't take the train/metro, get the 'Aeropuerto' blue bus, it takes you straight to Las Rambles square then its just a very short walk down one street to the hotel (PS don't risk the PICKPOCKETS on the underground/train station, it happened to me, a very 'Kind!?!? man offered to help carry my suitcase up the stairs, I repeatedily said NO! but as he was smiling cringingly at me his accomplice was helping himself to mine & my daughters passports & money, from my zipped up handbag over my shoulder! Luckily I caught him in time & he/they didn't get away with anything. We were a group of 15 Ladies on a HenWeekend (A Fantastic HenWeekend) & we were I guess easy targets! but keep your wits about you & Enjoy Barcelona PPS we found that Olympia was far nicer for evenings & we felt safer than Las Ramblas!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location !!”
Reviews.Author: mglobalz
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with very nice staff. Most importantly, the location can't be beat. However, please note that although they say they have wi fi -- it rarely works. Additionally, our room was very dark with one window that faced an alley and the walls were very thin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BabyDee454
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July of 2010, as a female solo traveller. I found the hotel to be very clean and worth the price I paid for. I wanted something in a good location where I could easily walk to the beach and some of the historic sites as well. I noticed some complaints about the service and I'm a little surprised, as I found the gentleman at the reception to be very nice. He even helped me upstairs with my bag (despite me telling him I was ok doing it myself) because the elevator was out of service. The only downside was that they did not have free wi-fi, which would have come in handy. I didn't care about not having lots of selection in terms of channels on the TV as I wasn't really in Barcelona to watch TV. The room itself and the bathroom were a decent size and very quiet. The hotel is older but it appears to be well maintained and looks really cute. It's just off La Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, very easy to get to if you take the airport bus into town (much cheaper than a cab). As for places to eat in barcelona, this is my 2nd time there and honestly I couldn't find much that wasn't overpriced and mediocre quality, but it's doable for a few days. I'd love to get some recommendations next time I go because I'd imagine there a lot of hidden gems.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel as they are extremely unprofessional and rude.”
Reviews.Author: maribara
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the man at the front desk was yelling at both my husband and I for making a reservation for 4 people (2 adults/2 small children) as opposed to 5 (2 adults/3 small children) and embarrassed all of us in front of other clients. He used such an accusatory tone as if we were trying to rip them off and not even realizing that their stupid hotel doesn't allow the entry of more than 4 people on the website, as U.S. hotels do. Nevertheless, they "allowed" us to stay there and set up 4 beds (after realizing that two of our children would fit in one bed). If it hadn't been for the fact that we paid for this without having the option to cancel, we would not have stayed here. It was horrible service. They don't even clean the rooms even if you ask them to.

Reviews.Title: “See you next year”
Reviews.Author: MelanieH0
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Friendly, helpful staff. Room was clean and fresh towels daily. Bed was perfect, had three restful nights sleep. Our room was to the side of the hotel so there was no view, not that we needed one as we were on a city break. Shower was brilliant. Did'nt want to get out. Breakfast was good too. Will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Man at front desk was rude!”
Reviews.Author: NoniKB
Reviews.Content: The man at the desk in the afternoon/evening was very rude. 10 euro/day charge for wi-fi. Location was good but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: ewillson
Reviews.Content: Located just off Las Ramblas, 2 mins from Placa da Catalunya. We stayed 2 nights midweek. Good value, did'nt have the breakfast as a great cafe located almost next door. Very friendly staff, we had a room with a large balcony, very nice. At night the streets do become full of dodgy looking characters and lots of prostitutes who can be hard to shake off !! My advice would be Don't wander off the main drag!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: popiel52
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well maintained. It is, however lacking in a few things that all hotels should have. Free WiFi is one as well as a better television selection. Being able to make coffe and tea in the room is usually always a given, but not here. The highlight of our stay was Manuel Cortes, at the front desk. What a wonderful young man ! Made our stay a truely memorable event. Give him a raise and a promotion. I would not hesitate recommending the Hotel Nouvel. I hope to return. Paul J. Gomes

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MarciaKH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older and did not have a few of the amenities we would have liked in a room which was our home for 6 nights, like windows to the outside world (we had two windows looking out into air shafts), there was no way to make coffee and tea, and WIFI costs 2 Euros/hour. However, we had a large, beautifully modern bathroom and clean towels daily. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and we especially enjoyed our conversations with Manuel C. at the front desk. Aside from being professional and helpful, he listened to our stories and made us laugh with his. His kindness will be remembered! The location of the Hotel could not be better. It is situated on a quiet, but busy small street off the Ramblas on one end, which is a major tourist area, and at the other end are gathering spaces and huge department stores for shopping. Restaurants and bakeries are just outside the front door. The Plaza Catalunya is just a block away, where one can find buses to attractions, neighboring towns and the airport. Very convenient. You may want to ask ahead for a room with a balcony and/or windows.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: shelley84
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, I can't understand how they can criticise the staff! We must have met different people. The staff on reception could not have been more pleasant & helpful. The hotel is perfectly located & the rooms were fine for the price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Far Away From this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: byaffe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nouvel has a good location in central barcelona, right by La Ramblas, and a fairly attractive lobby. These are the only good aspects of this terrible hotel. The mattresses are of the lowest quality and the walls are paper thin. You will hear all of your fellow guests each time they use the bathroom. Worse, the men at the front desk are the most surly, hostile and provocative hoteliers I've ever met. So unhelpful. We were also miffed at being put in a room without a window. The opening in our dowdy hotel room looked out -- true story-- into an elevator shaft!!! When we asked if other rooms were windowless as well, they told us all the interior rooms have no windows. And for this, $200 a night??? Give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bluegrace
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a one week stay in this hotel and I would highly recommend it. The location is great in a mostly pedestrianised street between La Rambla and another one going up to Placa Catalunya. Idealy situated from getting there from the airport on the aerobus to Placa Catalunya and then a five minute walk to being within walking distance of the main areas, loads of restaurants and cafes and near to two metro stations. The hotel itself is well presented and clean and our twin bedded room was fine with a large bathroom and plenty of hot water. The reception staff were courteous and helpful at all times. We had breakfast included and it was OK but there are lots of cafes nearby as well. And look out for guitar concerts at the Santa Anna church.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: KristalClear
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say I've seen this hotel before - as some friends were staying in there last year in a huge high ceiling room. It looks amazing indeed and I booked it myself for 3 nights mid-aug this year. If anything happens and wish to change your room or conditions - forget about it ! They are very rude in writing as well as in face to face contact, they do speak english and/or french, but they havent really heard of politness. I asked them how the Airco works and I got a pretty irritated answer : I don't know. When I said she should ask someone else then, she said : yes, but not now ! So that's pretty much my experience in there, the room was incredibly small (maybe because I made all the hassle for them to change it...). Anyway, I ended up with a small double room for the price of a triple...which was totally not worthet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near all the action!”
Reviews.Author: MediterraneanSeabird
Reviews.Content: While we were in Barcelona, we were going on a 1 week cruise. One night before the cruise and one night after, we stayed in the Nouvel Hotel. We had a very pleasant and enjoyable stay. The hotel is located off a small street with many quaint shops and eateries. Even better is the fact that it is so close to th main squares where you can find so many great things to do and many delicious restaurants. The interior of this hotel has a very beautiful architecture and the front desk staff were very helpful and efficient. The rooms were very basic but very clean. The beds were a little hard but this was not much of an issue unless you have a very sensitive back. The bathrooms were great and very spacious. Overall, this hotel was the perfect place for a short stay in Barcelona. It is a great value and the location cannot be beat! I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Roberto and Bob”
Reviews.Author: Aodh1
Reviews.Content: Roberto and Bob along with the other staff have excellent English. They both proved to be very helpful, cordial, efficient and friendly. The hotel is very centrally located and is ideal for those who do not wish to hire a car. The reception staff are a mine of information with regards to visiting the tourist attactions of Barcelona. One can buy tickets for visiting the Barcelona Aquarium, for example, at the reception desk. This means you avoid queueing to purchase a ticket at the aquarium. The queues at the aquarium can be long in high season. Also you can receive a small reduction for the bus tours of Barcelona from reception along with the general pack of information. Our double room proved to be quite small being approximately four metres square. The room was more than adequate for us as a pair of travellers. Our room had no view other than the wall of an adjoining building but that was not a concern to us. The shower was inside a bathtub and therefore not a walk-in cubicle. To us that did not prove an obstacle but it may do to someone older, infirm or disabled. All-in-all the Nouvel is a decent hotel, exceptionally well located, plain, clean, friendly at a reasonable price for Barcelona city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Saxman1Hamilton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is your typical European Hotel, however the location is great. Easy walking distance to Las Ramblas, Placa Catalunya, Metro, Airport Bus, Tourist Bus, La Boqueria, etc.

Reviews.Title: “iQue terrible!”
Reviews.Author: MSpainNyc
Reviews.Content: You might get sick at this hotel. There's no way of adjusting the air conditioner vent so that it doesn't blow right on you when you sleep. I have a nasty cold and sore throat. You can't take a shower with out standing ankle-deep in water. Housekeeping takes your towels away hours before they actually clean the room. So if you go back to the hotel, you can't wash up at all. It would have been nice if the concierge warned us of construction on the building; we got woken up at 8:00 to the sound of jackhammers and drills. Breakfast is not included; it costs 9 Euro per person. And come on, no free Wi Fi? The bed covers and walls look like an excerpt from the 1970s. The room above us must have had a leak in their bathroom because all we heard was constant dripping when they were done with their shower. To top it off, they screwed up our reservation, and instead of apologizing, we had to pay the price of their mistake. It's just really not as nice as the website promotes it to be.

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel just off the ramblas and the placa de catalunya”
Reviews.Author: gpp
Reviews.Content: When we visited (9 JUN 2010) the narrow side street (Santa Ana) was under construction. The windows and shutters kept out the noise, but off course you didn't want to open them either because of the construction. For many such an inconvenience will not matter, as you do not want to hang out in your hotel room when visiting Barcelona. Staff we met were professional and cordial. The lobby was small (typically European) and somewhat gloomy. Our room was spacious, plainly furnished. TV had a few channels and they were fuzzy (I like to take in the local news and that was OK, but I would have liked it if I could have seen World Cup highlights better.) Major complaint/s: water for the shower was at best tepid: made you soap up and rinse off very fast. Woke you up for sure. Few bath amenities: two very small bars of soap and something that passed for shampoo. The bed was fine and we slept very well. Others have complained about the street noise, but we thought the room was quite quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for me and my family”
Reviews.Author: Flaviusva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the third floor, room for three persons. Was very clean, quiet, the bathroom was roomie and had everything you need. Breakfast excellent and reception staff nice. Like everybody else I apreciated the location, in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - perfect - perfect”
Reviews.Author: hmpDenmark
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week in Barcelona - and our choise of staying in Hotel Nouvel certainly made the trip perfect. Our ratings tells it all - we had all we wanted for our vacation: very helpfull staff, very clean room (even clean towels every day), and a location you won't find better. Our room even had 2 balconies (room 241 - as we could see on the front of the hotel we had the only room with a big cornerbalcony). We will choose Hotel Nouvel next time, and next time and next time we will go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: kming05
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Barcelona while taking a mini-Euro trip this past Easter - and had minimal complaints about Hotel Nouvel. Got a great rate online, and had wanted to stay right on Las Ramblas as we wanted to cut our overall commute time as we only had 2.5 days to spend in Barcelona. All in all, Hotel Nouvel met our needs. The rooms weren't new, the bed was two twin size mattresses pushed together, so the hotel itself was not stunning. But the location right off off plaza catlunya was what makes this place worthwhile. The ease you can stroll right onto Las Ramblas and down to the beach in perfect weather. It was also nice having a small window/balcony facing the street. Flaws - no wifi - though somehow was able to get wifi from the hotel next door. I would definitely stay again because of the location, price, and comfort. Wasn't a five star, or four even, but was perfect for a 2 night stay before heading off to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kokbok
Reviews.Content: Great location only 3 minutes walk from the airport-bus. The noise from the corridor was very disturbing especially in the nights when people returned to the hotel, talking to each other and the sound from locking the doors and from shutting the doors would wake you up. You will need earplugs to be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely traditional hotel with excellent staff in the best location”
Reviews.Author: tellitasitisWales
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after a great flight, only 5 euros on the airport bus into Placa Catalunya and the hotel is literally 3 minutes away. Fantastic reception staff at all times who were more than helpful and explained where everywhere was and what we needed to get about. Room was spacious for the 3 of us, not luxurious but what do you need when you are only there for 2 nights. We also had a large terrace, perfect for relaxing with a glass of sangria and enjoying the sounds of the city. Breakfast was buffet style and plenty to choose from. The location of the hotel is what makes this perfect, just off La Rambla, you can walk out of the front door straight into the thick of it. Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for a stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: AngleseyAl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb location on a pedestrianised side street just off Las Ramblas,and within easy reach of all the tourist attractions. Loved the Art Nouveau entrance hall. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room (second floor front) very adequate and clean though beds somewhat hard. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly & beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: sesshouse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far enough down the side street not to hear the bustle of La Ramblas, but negligible walking distance! We shared a triple room on front corner, first floor of building. Amazing style & decoration, we knew we were on holiday! The room was cleaned, tidied and towels replaced daily. Menu was excellent and good value too. Elmo's patisserie over the road is a fantastic, friendly alternative for both breakfast and a take-away lunch (picnic in Parc Guell anyone?) Would go back tomorrow! :D

Reviews.Title: “It met our every need.”
Reviews.Author: lilfirecracker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nouvel because of the location before embarking on a cruise. We were happy to find the room very clean and comfortable. It was in the perfect location and the staff was great! We loved Barcelona and agreed that upon return we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Flaws, but with Character”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nouvel Hotel from November 5, 2009 to November 9, 2009 in room 127. Overall, my opinion was mixed and I will highlight the pros and cons of my stay. I was able to get this room for $52.00 a night. I had searched Barcelona hotel rates every other day for months and this hotel had a one-day sale when it normally sold for around $107.00 per night (next week it’s going for $199.00 a night). One major plus about staying here is the location. It’s just off La Rambla (make a sharp left turn after the first block on the left-hand side walking down from Placa Catalunya) and only about a 5-minute walk from the Aerobus stop at La Placa Catalunya. I’d recommend taking the Aerobus from the airport since it cost only 5 Euros per person and they leave every 15 minutes. The hotel is only a short 3-minute walk to the major subway stop in Barcelona, La Placa Catalunya. There are many nice bakeries and places to grab a bite just feet from the hotel on Calle Santa Anna. My wife enjoyed the Santa Anna Restaurant, which is steps away from the hotel and open until about midnight. The room itself did not meet my standards. First, it was very small. The bed was small as well. Actually, it was two single beds pushed together -- each with separate blankets. The bed was very hard. The bathroom was on the small side too. The shower was standing room only, though the pressure was very strong and the water very hot. I was most disappointed with the amenities. The bar of soap was less than a centimeter thick (no exaggeration) and there was no shampoo, conditioner, or lotion! They did provide some packets of body gel. There were two hand towels and two body towels that were on the small side. Some more towels would have been nice. The room did have a nice wall-mounted flat-screen television. The channel selection was pretty bad with only one channel in English. I think it will be a long time before I voluntarily watch the BBC World News channel again. The thermostat worked well so you could adjust the room temperature accordingly. The rooms were at least clean, which is a big plus. There were a lot of little things that could have improved the quality of the room. First, they only had one tiny wastepaper basket and that was in the bathroom. There was also no alarm clock radio. There was no coffee maker or refrigerator. There was not much closet space and drawers for clothes. The hallway area outside the room was very loud. The hallways have no carpeting which amplified the sound of closing doors and conversations. Also, the maid’s service cart was very loud whenever it moved. Although there were many minor issues with the room, it helps to remember that this is Europe and these types of rooms may be the norm. The hotel is also 92 years old. The staff was friendly and helpful. “Roberto” was very pleasant and helpful. He checked us in promptly and offered to tell us about the city, but we were pretty tired and my wife had previously visited Barcelona so we declined. He seemed a little offended, but none was meant. I also have to give credit to another staff member who did something right by NOT fulfilling a personal request. The room was registered under my wife’s last name, which is different from mine, and I lost my key. When I tried to get a replacement key to the room by myself, the staffer could not verify my claim that I was her husband (he had not seen me before). He did the right thing by not giving me a key since it shows they care about security. All the staff spoke English well. One aspect of my stay that was completely absurd and insulting is paying a 20 Euro deposit just to get a remote control for the television. What are they afraid of, that I’m going to fly from New York City to Barcelona with sinful thoughts of stealing a remote control to take home with me? It would never even work on my own television anyway! To paraphrase Ronald Reagan at the Berlin Wall in 1987, “Nouvel Hotel staff, tear down that remote control policy.” We did not fly all the way across the Atlantic Ocean to stay in our hotel room all day. Therefore, the room served its purpose and I was able to relax at the end of a day of sightseeing. Also, for $52.00 a night along with its prime location, I saved a lot of money. Had I paid a lot more, I might have given a lower circle rating. If you like the antique charm, then add a circle. Don’t forget to bring your own soap and shampoo and keep your expectations in check. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed for a short break”
Reviews.Author: OxfordCrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Nouvel is ideally located just off Las Ramblas and Place de Catalunya so it's ideal for a short break where you just need somewhere to sleep and enjoy a breakfast before a long day sight seeing. There are hundreds of restaurants close by and a fantastic range of shops to suit all pockets. If value for money is what you are looking for Nouvel fits the bill. If height of luxury is you're need go elsewhere and pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice”
Reviews.Author: Macman1940
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of its location in the Bari Gotic region of the city. Be aware that you should not stay here if you are driving a car! We were traveling by train so parking was not an issue. The hotel is located just off the Ramblas in the old section of the city. The staff was very nice but the room was very small and very noisy. We were on the second floor and our window was over a passage that led to a restaurant. People gathered there into the early hours talking loudly. There are probably quieter rooms in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: SAZ312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our time at Nouvel Hotel. The location was terrific as it was just a block off of Las Ramblas, and yet far enough away so as not to be disturbed by the non-stop noise. There are several cafes on this cute side street. Our room was sizeable, with a small balcony, which was enjoyable. Great water pressure in the shower, which is not always a given. The staff was very accommodating. Internet is offered free of charge in the lobby. You may purchase it for a reasonable fee in your room, although the service is somewhat spotty. We would stay here again ... a great spot in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AXEBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We were staying in BCN for 2 nights on the front end our trip and one night on the tail end. We needed a room that could hold 3 people. Hotel Nouvel was able to accomodate with 3 twin beds. Our first room was great. We had a balcony and tons of light. Very comfortable and clean. The staff was super helpful and friendly even when we got in after 3:30a one night. Our second room needed to hold 4 people. No problem We had 4 twin beds in the room. This room was an interior room so we had no windows. The pros: great location. Right off Las Ramblas. Very quiet. Close to the Aerobus at Placa Catalyuna. Cons: no real amenities including remote for tvs or alarm clocks. No bar on site. But other than that, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff. (Even have rooms with Three Beds!)”
Reviews.Author: carriealison
Reviews.Content: Three girls and I recently stayed at the Novel Hotel in Barcelona for the week of La Merce. Our room was a little expensive but we booked a triple room during the festival week for about $225 USD per night from Expedia.com about 2 months prior to trip. Entire staff speaks great English. Location is right off La Rambla (main walking st and overall we think it is an excellent hotel and would recommend it to all our friends. On the N side of the Barri Gothic which has tons of restaurants and ice cream shops. You must try the waffles with chocolate on top! Amazing! There are two pastry shops on the same street as hotel, we ate there one night for dinner and the prices and service were great. We had cheese pizzas and horchata! We also had the chocolate croissants, don't miss these! Location is right across the street from the La Rambla (main walking street which leads to the ocean) and near the Placa de Catalunya. Across the street from the metro station. Breakfast from 7 to 10:30 AM consisted of eggs, sausages, cereal, fresh fruit, croissants (ours was included with the price) All our requests were tended to immediately (requesting cabs, asking for extra toiletries, fixing the A/C). If you are confused about where to stay, choose this hotel you can take a metro anywhere in the city from here. Cab to airport was 35 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Other hotels are better”
Reviews.Author: Elizwannatravel
Reviews.Content: Our room was very tiny and we couldn't even dry off in our bathroom because it was so small. We had a "courtyard" room which meant it looked out in darkness to the rooms across from ours. Noisy because of sounds echoeing up the walls from the downstairs. Bed was a rock but the room was spotless. Hotel staff was curt except for one man who was wonderful. We would not recommend Hotel Nouvel as there are a lot of better hotels in Barcelona near Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Here At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: xmrrocknrollx
Reviews.Content: Granted this was a very nice hotel but the staff was hands down the most rude staff in the world. It's easy to assume that the only thing that matters with a hotel is finding a clean, quiet one in a prime location but if the staff is horrible, it makes your time in the hotel miserable. They forbid us from allowing ANY guests (we had 2 friends there staying at a hostel who met up with us) into our hotel room. And when they came up one night for drinks before we went out, they tried fining us! I hate to say this and I'm sure not all French are like this but because we were American they definitely had some sort of grudge or bias against it, never again would I stay in this hotel and I pray anyone else traveling avoids this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LindaWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have picked a more perfect location for exploring Barcelona. The hotel was down a small side street just off Las Ramblas and we were woken in the morning by the wonderful smell of fresh bread from the bakery opposite. The staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent English. The room was clean and tidy and perfect for our short weekend stay. The breakfast was the usual continental breakfast with a small selection of warm food, It wasn't a brilliant breakfast, however there was plenty so you could keep re-filling your plate! My only complaint - and it's a minor one - is the fact that the beds were very hard. Overall I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. You could not wish for a better location and such friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't Everything”
Reviews.Author: BBSLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: I don't usually like sleeping on a board covered with a sheet but that's what we did here. Tiny rooms with hard beds. Was noisy as we tried to snooze during the day to get over the jet lag. Some construction going on in the hotel. Location was great, just off the top of Las Rambles. Had to navigate the hookers to get to the hotel late at night but they were harmless. Had to ring and wait outside until the clerk cam to the door to make sure we were guests. Desk clerks all cool, but the best one went back to school during our stay. English not a problem. Also never stayed anyplace where we had to leave a deposit (20Euros) to get a TV remote. Internet was $$$ and slow and quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm with modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: MNSoprano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place to stay. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location was perfect for exploring Barcelona. I loved the old style charm of the lobby but also appreciated the modern, especially bathroom, facilities. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel with warmth and character this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DSK4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a small sideway from Rambla, The rooms are quite small and not very fresh, but if you are on vacation and using the rooms just for showers and slepping, its more than adequate The hotel is close to Plaza the Catalunya where buses to the airport, touristbus, touristsenter etc are located. And it is only 5min walk to the Barric Gotic area with restaurants and cathedrals. I would not recommend the breakfast at the hotel as there is a cafe just opposite the hotel with delicous Bocadillos (sandviches) and bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare come to life.”
Reviews.Author: langhitlk
Reviews.Content: If, like me you were looking for a reasonable hotel with great location, reasonable pricing and good rating hotel nouvel may appear an attractive prospect. Although i cant fault the location, it goes without saying the hotel should be dropped to a 0 rating if ever one so existed. Let me give you a brief insight into what exactly goes on at hotel nouvel: 1) there were cockroaches in the rooms. 2 no minibar and when i asked for ice, the staff had the audacity to tell me to buy something from the restaurant (all overpriced) before they would give me a couple. 3) my toothbrush and clothing items were missing from my room. 4) the staff were the most rude staff iv ever had the displeasure of dealing with. Unless youre over 50, the staff treat you like swine. I was sweared at the first time i had the tv loud in my room (including f's and s's). Noone to help with luggage. When i asked whether there were any good restaurants in the area, the language barrier made it a little difficult to understand, but when i asked them to repeat it, they told me to 'go away and find it myself'. They not only insulted me but there fellow guests as well. i know first hand that the staff's behaviour was not just resticted to us. 5) On the day we arrived we were given a curfew at 10pm! doors shut after, and if by chance youre late, the swearing happens all over again without us saying a word. 6) The rooms may look attractive, however, once you're there the hotel is dark and dingy, the rooms are small and infested. However, beside the cockroaches. there was a bed, shower and sink all good. There was a lot to be dissapointed with and if you, like me, surfed the web for hours looking for a nice hotel really close to the city centre with is nicely in your price range, and come across hotel nouvel, please do look again, because after staying at a hostel straight afterwards the hostel, rated 1, was a lot better, im not kidding and this was with regard to staff, location, and price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: waggy
Reviews.Content: Friends stayed here as we stayed in another, they got best deal. Nice entrance and lobby. Bedrooms and bathrooms tastfully modernised

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyD64
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel Nouvel with 3 friends. This hotel is ideally situated right next to Las Ramblas and was clean and well kept. The hotel reception staff were extremely helpful and were able to offer good advice. Although we had visited before, we still used the Bus Turistic to see the sights on the Red and Blue routes. Would also recommed the day excursion to Montserrat which includes a stop at Torres winery and also at Sitges. The flamenco show at Cordobes is well worth a visit which included a superb buffet. Also check out the boat trips from the port, particularly the catamarran which was only about 13 euros for an hour and a half trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ElvisC
Reviews.Content: Won this trip through WeWin4u, so didn't have to pay for the room, but found the hotel clean and tidy. Rooms are small but adequate, but the location is excellent near the top of the Ramblas near the main square - just a few minutes from the airport (blue bus) stop. Can be a little noisy in the evening - probably better on a higher floor. We thought the breakfasts were great, European buffet style but plenty to choose from - worth stocking up before a day out. Reception sell reduced price tourist bus tickets - go for the red route if you're only doing one, and were generally very helpful. Wi-fi access is available but a bit expensive - but theres an internet cafe round the corner which is as cheap as chips (they also do cheap long distance calls). Reception will tell you where.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly...welcoming...attractive Art Deco decor..but slightly over-priced.”
Reviews.Author: BucksTraveller60
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly, welcoming, willing to help & approachable. Room had no window but was spacious & air-conditioned. Room was comfortable & looked recently decorated, bathroom newly fitted. Everything worked well, which is a bonus! Breakfast was fine, enough choice for me. Communal areas of hotel were sufficient....who wants to stay in anyway when there's Barcelona to explore! Felt generally that prices were too high, but probably this is due to proximity to Las Ramblas etc. My first time as a solo traveller, I felt relaxed & safe at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Location, FRIENDLY Staff”
Reviews.Author: polly095
Reviews.Content: Lovely English speakiung staff, clean newly renovated rooms, stacks of storage space and couldn't ask for a better position, just a minute away from La Ramblas, taxis, shops and bars. They even smiled when twice we had to ring the door at 2.30 a.m. to let us in! Breakfast was a basic continental but plenty of it and there was also frankfurters and scrambled eggs every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Clean, Lovely & Romantically Decorated with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Aquaries21
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel (1-3 Apr). i heard it is a newly renovated hotel which was why it is so lovely. Our room was number 248. Straight to the point. Everything you could ask for a hotel. Clean, Comfortable, Good Location (walking distance down La Ramblas all the way to Colum statue, all the way up to Casa Batllo, to Hard Rock Cafe & Metro), Good & friendly service, safe big enough for a laptop for EUR 3. Hi-speed Wifi. Love the bathroom the most... a 3* hotel with 5* bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “So so hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoecrazybaby
Reviews.Content: From first glance this hotel looks lovely, it is just of La Rambla (so good location) and the entrance is nice and grand with high ceilings and big mirrors and chandeliers. The man on reception on friendly and gave us a map and showed us what and where to go and recommended restaurants etc. When we (boyfriend and I) got to the bedroom we had booked a double, but got twin. I went downstairs to ask fro a double but the hotel was full, this was very disappointing, we did push the beds together but it’s not the same. The room is very basis and rather drab in colour. Our bathroom was not modern in the slightest but was ok and clean. The rooms overall are small. Our room 130 was next to the staff lift, so you couldn’t open one window as all you could hear and see was the lift, which you could also here with the window closed from 5 in the morning constantly and if you opened the other window each morning you could hear the industrial washing machines that were so loud, so there was no peace and quite and hard to get fresh air. I would suggest if you book this hotel specify you do not want room 130, 230 etc! You had to pay for the safe and put a deposit down for the remote which I thought was rather cheeky therefore decided against it. Overall this hotel is ok if you just want a convenient location and a clean place to sleep, although saying that we did see a cockroach walking the corridors which is always disgusting! A spring clean and a brush of paint would make this hotel feel a lot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a moderate price hotel”
Reviews.Author: jw71
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with my wife and daughter. Picked this hotel because of the location, which is terrific, and the availability/price for a triple room. The room was spacious and reasonably comfortable. The hotel is very noisy due to being right on the street and having marble floors with no carpeting. The hotel is centrally located just off the Ramblis and within a half a block of the Metro. It is an easy walk to the cathedral and the Picasso Museum. There are lots of restaurants close by and many quality stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Biri
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel as a Top Secret hotel on Lastminute.com and found it to be very good value for the location. We took the bus from the airport and it is less than 5 minutes walk from Plaza Cataluyna where the bus stops. The public areas are very pleasant and the hotel feels calm and quiet despite its busy location. The staff were fine - not especially welcoming or friendly but not unpleasant. The lift was broken and they did not really make any effort to apologise or help with our bags. The room was fine - quite small and the bed was more like a camp bed but reasonably comfortable. The bathroom was modern and clean with a very powerful shower. The decor in the room was tatty and could easily be improved. We didn't have breakfast there as it was disproportionately expensive. There is a locked luggage room which was useful but it is also the boiler room and therefore very hot so be careful what you leave in there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel good servise”
Reviews.Author: regev
