Reviews.Content: it was plasure to share my weekation in Nouvel hotel Nouvel hotel is like a botiqe hotel' Excellent servise and good athmospher

Reviews.Title: “A Great Personal-Touch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klinepa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Nouvel Hotel in Barcelona several times. It is in a great central location, close to the majority of tourist sights in Barcelona. It is located on a pedistrian street, filled with a few shops and little eateries and bakeries. The staff at the hotel is most helpful. They are always so cheerful and are very willing to assist in any recommendations for sightseeing. On this trip, my ATM card was not activated and I was without access to my account. The senior staff member recommended that I visit a secure internet location to email my bank. He sent me to a "Staples-like" business, where I had access to email and for 1 Euro, I sent an email to my bank. Within a few hours, my bank took the hold off of my card and I had full access to my ATM. We love the streetside rooms to sit on the balcony and people-watch. The hotel is also very close to Plaza Catalunya for transport to airport or to use the metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: norters1980
Reviews.Content: I realise this review is a little late but after reading some of the other comments made here I thought I should add my own. My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in September 2007 and encountered nothing but exceptional service and standards. We arrived slightly earlier than check-in but the man at the desk allowed us to use the luggage store for us to store our bags while we had our first explore of the city. After check-in we paid the 20e deposit for the television remote (which we were quite happy to pay, you DO get it back after all unless you do something stupid with it) and went to check out our room which we found perfectly sized with a good sized bathroom. In the morning of our second day the extremely friendly man on the desk (a different one) filled us in on the best way to see the city and sold us a two day pass for the tourist bus (fun bus) which was possibly our best purchase of the trip with stops all over the city and very frequent services. All in all, I would highly reccommend this hotel for it is cheap, clean and the staff are nothing short of excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good small hotel”
Reviews.Author: brighton-england
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel nouvel for 4 days in july and had a great time, this hotel is in a fabulous location, just off la rambla and place de catalunya. the rooms are small but very clean and the staff were most helpful. it has a lobby with chandeliers and a very quaint lift. the breakfast was good, it was supposed to be continental but there was scrambled egg , sausages and beans available as well as cold meats and cheese, plenty of toast, yoghurts and as much tea and coffee as you could manage. not a 5 star hotel but great location and much cheaper than a hotel on la rambla. iwould stay here again and would recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mistyWales
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week for 4 nights .nice and clean hotel.and room was nice there is no tea or coffee facilites in your room but there is a coffiee machine down stairs .we were told there wasnt a bar in the hotel but we found it in the restaraunt on our last nite..situated in an exellent place near to the main street. we had to walk down a creepy alley way to get to it late at nite as the taxi driver coudnt find it, but we had driven past it ones lol we didnt eat in the hotel as we found it cheaper in one of the many places in the town i would stay here again if i went back to barcelona, if you want to go to the beach i would recomend you get a taxi for around 10 euros because its a bit of a walk. happy holidays it cost us 30 euros for a taxi from the airport to the hotel i think they charged us more as we had 4 sutcases and 4 passengers. its cheaper by the bus

Reviews.Title: “Goodness knows what hotel some of the other reviewers were staying at”
Reviews.Author: Paul079
Reviews.Content: I was in a party that booked four separate rooms. Good points The hotel's location is excellent. The breakfast is good. Bad points Surly staff - one woman on reception was as awkward as they come - some of the others were not much better. I only saw two members of staff smile over 4 days. Room cleaning variable. The towels were not changed every day. Rooms variable. Singles can be tiny - do not rely on being able to relax back at the hotel - this is a guest house type hotel. Weird air conditioning controlled by reception. I do not think it works during the day. We were cold at night - another in the party was not aware his room had air conditioning it was so bad. There is TV in the rooms - variable quality of set. You might be lucky with a flat screen or unlucky with an old TV. There is only one English channel - BBC World. you have to leave €20 deposit at the desk to get a remote control. Some TV's will not work without it. No fridge, tea or coffee making facility. There is a vending machine downstairs. All rooms have a safe but you have to pay extra. I was forced to pay for my full stay on arrival. This always makes me feel like I am being treated as a criminal. Generally I got the feeling it is far too easy for hoteliers to make money in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money- nice room too”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona_visitor
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest three star hotel i was able to find. I stayed on the 5th floor and was very impressed with my room (especially after seeing some photos that were already on here!). Note- you have to pay 1.50 euros per nite if you want a safe. You also have to provide a 20 euro deposit for remote to use the tv but this is refunded at the end of stay Very close to the Ramblas! We also had a mini balcony where we could sit and enjoy the sunshine. It was also helpful that they provided breakfast, cereal, scrambled eff, toast, cheese, ham, yogurt, orange etc One thing to note, the hotel is the first left off the top of the Ramblas- Santa Anna road. This should help you find it easier to locate!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathic123
Reviews.Content: This hotel i well located just off Las Ramblas however it needs a makeover and a fresh customer service attitude. The hotel rooms are adequate but dingy. The pillow was filled with lumps. The breakfast could have been so much nicer with fresh fruit instead of canned in the middle of May with a beautiful fresh market just 2 blocks away. We were charged 1.50 euro cash when we arrived after spending 317.00 USD for the room which felt less than welcoming upon arrival. This was a beautiful old hotel at it's prime but at the moment, I would not recommend it to a friend. They need to begin with some new pillows!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Simple, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Otoko25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located just off the Rambla - right in the centre of town and a short stroll from the main metro station. The staff were friendly, spoke several languages and were helpful if you wanted any local advice. We stayed in a triple room with three single beds as a last minute cheap city break. Rooms are basic but clean with a balcony. It had a nice powerful shower in a fairly large bathroom. Beds were quite old but comfortable enough. Breakfast comprised your usual Continental fair of bread, croissants and cereals with coffee on tap. All-in-all a very good hotel for what we paid, especially in regards to location. If were to go for a repeat cheap break would stay in again but those seeking luxuary should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: schoir
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone in Barcelona and booked a double room at the Hotel Nouvel because they did not have any single rooms left. The gave me a room on the top floor with a balcony overlooking Calle Santa Anna. It was spacious and comfortable, though the furniture bordered on spartan. The bathroom was really nice -- all marble tiles, and even a bidet. The complimentary breakfast buffet is really nice -- fresh juice, rolls, toast, cold meats and cheese, cereal, and fruit. The location can't be beat. The staff knew I was traveling alone and made me feel welcome. They were very helpful, letting me know the closing times of certain attractions, giving directions and ordering a taxi for me at 4am to the airport for an early morning flight. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise getaway”
Reviews.Author: Martin B
Reviews.Content: I was surprised for my Birthday and spent two nights in this lovely hotel. Staff excellent (speaking immaculate English) Breakfast good Location excellent within easy reach of the Cathedral and the Harbour Room clean and tidy (albeit very small)

Reviews.Title: “Ideal B&B on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: cockerhamsands
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on 12 January 2008. Found the staff very friendly and the hotel was clean and decent facilities. If your after a bed and half decent breakfast - this is the one for you. If you want all the trimmings smack on Las Ramblas then be prepared to pay upto three times as much! I found it ideal and was staying with two children (9 and 10).

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, excellent location, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sarahmas
Reviews.Content: With the Hotel Nouvel, you definitely get what you pay for. This was a budget hotel with all the fun and follies that go along... lights that only worked with a key inserted... a showerhead that kind of sprayed all over the place... a toilet that you had to sit sideways on because it was so close to the sink. But the sheets and towels were clean, the heat and hot water worked well, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast was generous and of decent quality. And, like many others have said, the location is excellent. You are right on La Rambla, walking distance from the ocean, and near the metro to get anywhere else. Warning: if you come here for a weekend, give yourself an hour to wait in line for the airport buses in Catalunya! In summary, if I was looking for a fancy, well appointed, luxurious hotel, I'd look elsewhere. But for a quick and cheap weekend away, Hotel Nouvel fits the bill well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Cheap on Service”
Reviews.Author: risermon
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location, however for $161 EU/night, I was expecting more in the way of service and amenities. After a couple of days of seeing the same spots on the sheets, I asked the head clerk to have the rather low quality sheets changed. He says they only change the sheets every third day! Well, I'm sure they're very concerned about the environment, but for that $, they need to change the sheets daily. I also couldn't believe how cheap they were with bathroom amenities. No shampoo, one small squeeze bag of body gel, no conditioner. Even one-star hotels do better than that. Shower had half window, rather than full curtain, which wasn't sufficient to keep water off the floor. Breakfast buffet was good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ab4113
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights, clean, tidy excellent location friendly staff, could not ask for any more, would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hannah128
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, the first weekend in Oct. My partner was ill after getting off the airplane and arriving at the hotel about 10:00am. We were told our room would not be available until 2:00 p.m. , per hotel policy. So, we sat in the lobby to make the best of it. Twenty minutes later, the manager had a room for us. It was a beautiful corner room, very large, and very, very quiet. The hotel staff were most helpful and the rooms were extremely clean. The location of this hotel is fantastic!! We were able to walk to whatever we wanted to see. The value is great. A+ recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Stay”
Reviews.Author: Howard1737
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Nouvel for 7 nights. We found this hotel to be excellent value for money with modest but very comfortable accommodation. All you need when you are out all day enjoying beautiful Barcelona. The staff were very helpful and the continental breakfast had plenty of choice and everything kept being refilled. The Hotel staircase was being decorated. Painter worked late but we did not hear any noise or suffered any inconvience. Room was serviced everyday, clean and very quiet. Would have no hesitation in staying at the hotel in the future. Loation couldn't be better. One minute walk to Ramblas and Metro station. Less than 5 minutes to airport bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Aries100
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, down a quiet and safe pedestrian street off Las Ramblas, 3 minutes walk from the airport bus stop. We stayed in a really quiet twin room, very clean and looked like the bathroom had been newly renovated. Room cleaned every day, towels replaced. Staff were very friendly and accomodating. There seems to be some redorating going on but it didn't effect us. Breakfast was standard, anything which ran out was replaced very quickly. There are about 3 cafes within 20 metres of the hotel entrance and all offering coffee and croissant for less than 2 euros as an alternative to the hotel breakfast. We had heard about pickpockets/muggings in Barcelona but on out first night, we encountered a hotel guest at reception who had just been pickpocketed. Las Ramblas is so busy day and night, that incident just reinforced that you really need to take the minimum amount of cash etc out with you at all times, like you would in any strange city really.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AileenBonnybridge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days in Barcelona staying at the Nouvel Hotel. I booked this hotel before I checked the reviews( I know thats the wrong thing to do) but in this case we would have missed a good hotel if we had paid attention to the bad reviews. Everything worked for us. The reception staff were polite, the breakfast was plentiful, the room was very clean and comfortable with a great shower in bathroom. Everything we needed for our short stay. Yes the hotel is being redecorated and the workmen are in but they tend to work in the evening and they are making the hotel look even better. We had a room looking over an alley and we were not disturbed by anyone during the night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great location and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pendragon56
Reviews.Content: This was a disappointing hotel. I booked this through "Just one hotel" The picture at the time of booking was of a very modern hotel, what a shock I had when I arrived here. The hotel was very basic, the room was clean but needed updating, the breakfast I will not mention as I might be rude. The plus side, the staff were helpful and it did have a good location. When I got home I let "Just one Hotel " know my feels but you guessed it the picture has now changed!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLucyLove
Reviews.Content: Dreadful. Do not stay here! I booked this hotel because of its location and reasonable price; do not be tempted by either! In the first room, 256, there was a terrible rumbling noise, maybe from the air conditioning (even when turned off!) or pipes, I requested a room change and was told there were no more rooms available, the receptionist was very rude and extremely unhelpful, after an argument he found - with no apparent problem! - another room, 374, I waked in and walked straight back out, the stench from the bathroom was sickening, I went back to reception and asked for another room, again he said there were none available, after another argument I was given room 362, it was lovely! Well, as long as you don't mind hearing every single footstep or word spoken in the hall outside! Why didn’t I just walk out and find a better hotel where the staff are polite and helpful??? I should have!!! The following morning when I was (as I have done in countless other hotels!) going back to my room after breakfast with a cup of hot water, the receptionist let rip!!! I won’t go into the gory details but I was mortified, he was so confrontational and aggressive and all this in front of other guests that were either checking in or out at the time, apparently hotel rules state you can not take a cup of hot water out of the restaurant to your room! Well there is a way to tell someone and there was his way!!! I could not believe his tone, his manner, I was a paying guest in the hotel. I felt like I was committing the worst crime known to man! He was beyond reason! Do not stay here, do not be tempted by the great location or the reasonable rates, the hotel was maybe lovely once but now it is in need of a major overhaul and big clean up. As for the receptionists…they were the absolute rudest, most unhelpful, most confrontational, condescending, rotten people I have ever encountered. Dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: kives
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great disappointment. It was more like a B&B than a 3* hotel as all we had to use was the bedroom and the breakfast room which was closed off following breakfast. There were no "public areas" to use as they were being decorated. The advertised Luna Restaurant we were informed was actually the "breakfast" room, not a restaurant! The bar by the "restaurant" was never in use during our stay. Our rear room balcony was overlooked by tenements. On a good point the hotel was very convenient for the centre of Barcelona. Will visit Barcelona again, but to stay in one of the other hotels we found. A most disappointing wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and easy”
Reviews.Author: KaiStick
Reviews.Content: Litle hotel with different room sises. I think we had the smallest one :-) But it was clean, and the aircondtion was ok. But, the matrass was wery hard, that was the only negative. Wery good help in the resepsion. Breakfast was ok, and the same every day... Nearby the Las Ramblas (50 m), and near Plasa Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, great city, great time”
Reviews.Author: celticrover
Reviews.Content: we spent three wonderful days in barcelona,( pre cruise).. we found the nouvel hotel to be a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Medicore”
Reviews.Author: Richard02
Reviews.Content: The hotel web site charged my credit card immediately after making the reservation but I could never reconfirm on their web site. They didn't even send an email confirmation. When I entered my confirmation number it said "cannot be found". So I had to call the hotel directly from the US before I left to reconfirm. Upon arrival the staff was nice enough but the rooms were really old and tired. It was not a good value at all. There was no iinternet acess either. I think there are many other options and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for price!”
Reviews.Author: AliceGr
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. It offers a great breakfast that is served in a nice dining room. We had no problem with service, but another American family we met ,did experience rude service. The hotel was clean and our room was larger than some. The hotel would be improved by having Internet access. When we left the hotel we used a taxi that came to the door. This was a mistake. It is a very narrow street and we were blocked by a truck. The meter didn't stop running. The best thing to do is to walk to the first main street and find your own taxi. Overall, try to avoid using a taxi in Barcelona. We were very unhappy with the charges and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Friendly & helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: stumps
Reviews.Content: My Mum who is 73 and I stayed at the Novel Hotel 26th June for 3 days, booked through Easy jet who were the cheapest. We had read the reviews and took pot luck as they differed so much. We were not dissapointed. On arrival at Barcelona airport, we took the A1 bus to place de Catalunya for e3.75, very cheap! The hotel was 5 minutes walk from the square, off the Ramblas, and easy to find. We were welcomed by Roberto who was very charming and very helpful. He explained how to see Barcelona in the short time we were there, where to get the tourist bus etc. The hotel is old and there was some work being done in the foyer but it was clean and comfortable and excellenlty located which is what you need when in Barcelona for just a few days. The ceilings are very high and the doors to the room were huge, must have been at least 10 foot high. We stayed in room 244 which was at the side and had a tiny balcony. The room was bigger than some we have stayed in and adequate for our stay. It also had a flat screen TV which was a surpise, however, you needed to pay 20e deposit for a remote which was given back when you returned it!The bathroom was nice and had a hairdryer, bidet, bath and a great shower! Breakfast was simple, you had to find a table and was self service. The scrambled egss were good but the beans were not our baked beans and the sausages were frankfurters! But there were cereals, bread rolls, croissants, fruit, yogurts cold meats and cheese along with teas, coffee and fruit juices. Although not what we would expect in a hotel at home, it was adequate to start your day. We found most restaurants in the Ramblas quite repetative but found a great restaurant that you should visit and we highly recomend. It was off the Ramblas, going towards the Port, Teatre place and called La Fonda. It was very popular and we had to wait for a table despite it being on 3 levels. We had a 3 course meal each, a jug of sangria and teas and coffees and the total cost was e35! It was not a fixed menu like a lot of restaurants in the area and the food was fresh, excellently presented and the staff were lovely. To travel around we would recommend the tourist bus which has 3 lines, red, blue and green for 19e for 1 day, 24e for 2 days, rather than the Barcelona bus which has just the one route. You also get a booklet of vouchers which gives you money off entrance fees etc. We would also recomend a visit to Monserat, a fantastic place. We decided to do the trip on our own and bought a ticket from tourist information for 29e which included, metro, train, funiculars, cable cars, all entrance fees and lunch in the self service restaurant at Monserat.. This worked out half the price for a half day tour and was easy to do on your own. Considering my mum is 73, she says she would recomend the hotel to her friends as it was centrally located, the staff were nice and after a busy day walking around the sights of Barcelona, all you want to do is sleep in a bed before you start again the next day. If you want to pay a lot more money and have 5* accomodation, then do not stay at this hotel, but if you are looking for a central location and are happy to have basic room with breakfast my Mum and I would recomend the Nouvel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCheshuntAngie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nouvel from 1st to 4th June, I read that the hotel was one of the oldest in barcelona with original features, and this was true the hotel was tired and dated and could do with some modernisation. The rooms were very basic but clean, there were no tea making facilities which i found odd as most hotels have this. Breakfast was continental , you wont get a hot cup of tea as the water urn was luke warm every morning and the coffee was very strong. Another thing which drove me mad was the flushing of the toilets you could hear next doors loo being flushed, and some of the guests werent exactly quiet when returning late at night. There was no bar in the hotel but this isnt a problem as there are many bars nearby, the staff were pleasant and helpful, and the location was great with a lovely pattiserie opposite which sold lovely rolls and cakes. Barcelona is a great place to visit and I found that 4 days isnt long enough as there is so much to see, a must is the fountains at night which are lit up and move to classical music ....there are no public toilets here tho, get the tube to espania station on the green line, Use the tourist buses you can buy the tickets at the tourist information , they have blue and red lines and u can get on and off as often as you wish, but the buses only go one way so dont do as i did and jump off and then want to visit the previous attraction .

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Harry
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful break in Barcelona staying at Nouvel Hotel. The location is just behind Las Ramblas and is perfect for walking to most areas. The hotel is clean the decor is fine, staff helpful and friendly. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again. Great value with lovely continental breakfast provided.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice but dont think much of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: nikitrepak
Reviews.Content: 6 ladies in early twenties went for a hen party weekend! we arrived late on the friday and found the reception staff to be welcoming and promtly got us to our rooms as we were tired from a delayed flight! We found our rooms to be very clean and tidy and was shocked at the plasma screen televisions (but dissapointed that ALL the channels were in Spanish and not one single English speaking channel) We went to a local restaurant for some food that was not all that good and overpriced then straight back to the hotel to sleep, when we got in to bed we were a little dissapointed as the beds were very hard (more like sleeping on the tiled floor!) and only one pillow per bed we looked for extra pillows in the wardrobes but found none!! When we got in the shower the only thing that can be said about the hotel showers is that it defines a whole new meaning to the word power shower it is more like getting tattoed (absolutley brilliant) we could have spent the whole weekend in the shower and had more fun than we did in Barcelona!! There was an odour coming from outside the bathroom window however this was not a problem with the windows closed! I would not reccomend Barcelona to people that have sensitive noses as just about everywhere we visited stinks! the location of the hotel was amazing you could not be nearer to the hussle and bussel of Barcelona. Checking out was as easy as checking in the reception staff made it a simple process! Wouldnt go back again as a group but would reccomend this hotel to couples or the elderley.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Italy_06
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not great, but were okay for a week's stay. The beds were not too uncomfortable. Considering how much time you actually spend in the hotel room during vacation, it was tolerable. We had the triple room, since we were travelling with a six year old. it was very spacious for the 3 of us. The staff were extremely nice and very helpful. They were able to get my husband tickets for a match, which he was extremely ecstatic about, being the futbol fanatic that he is. Breakfast was decent. It consisted of eggs, fruit, cold cereal, sweet breads, toast, hard rolls, meats, yougurts, juice and coffee. One draw back, was there were no irons or ironing boards. We had to go buy a small travel one. The great thing about this hotel, is the location. It is literally in the middle of everything! Las Ramblas is just right down the street. El Corte Inglese is around the corner. Pastry shops and cafes right in front and to teh side of teh hotel. It especially makes a big diffrence when shopping all day or tired of sightseeing, that you can comeback to rest or drop off your bags. We definitely learned our lesson last year in Rome, after staying in a "suburban" hotel away from the city . I would rather put up with the hustle & bustle of a major city, then "hike" back to your hotel w/ a tired & cranky 6yr. old after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RogueRogan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Formula One weekend - all hotel prices were inflated for the weekend, however this was one of the few with spare rooms. I'd booked the flights first so didn't have much of a choice other than to find somewhere! The hotel staff were very helpful and accomodating, we got a large room - a double with a spare single bed. So had plenty of room, was very quiet as I'd requested - so they certainly try to meet any reasonable special requests you make. There was no minibar in the room, but was furnished to a high standard, everything looked well maintained and relatively new. Breakfast was okay but not anything special. Was certainly filling and kept you going for most of the day. Fairly good selection of items too. What was best for the hotel was certainly the location and allows easy access to the most popular areas of Barcelona. Would consider staying here again due to the service we got from the staff and the hotel's location. Though in the UK this hotel would probably only recieve a 3* rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slavezero
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in a triple room it was basic but comfortable and very clean.The reception staff we very friendly and helpfull ,breakfast was a good continetal selection.The hotel is in a superb location just of la ramblas overall a great trip we would defineltly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Angelica_Demon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for three nights just after Valentines day. It was absolutely 100% better than I ever expected given the fact it is reasonably priced (for a central city hotel) and some of the, frankly baffling, reviews I'd seen on here. Basically if you want to experience Barcelona like a real European, stay at this hotel. When we arrived we were placed in a twin room with the beds pushed together (meaning one massive bed!), and not one but two quant shuttered balconette windows looking out onto the side street the entrance of the hotel was off of. The bathroom was big enough and there was an English speaking (albeit American) news channel on television (what else do you really need?). The room was spotless, and remained so for the stay as the cleaners did an excellent job. The breakfast was authentic European, with croissants, pastries, toast, fruit, cereal, juice, tea and coffee with some scrambled eggs and sausages if you wished to have them.We mainly just pigged out on everything in readiment for a long day pounding the pavements! There is a bakery directly opposite the hotel entrance that serves excellent baguette sandwiches for you to pack for lunch on the run, and then of course you only need to walk to the end of the road in one direction and you are on Las Ramblas (the main shopping and cafe street) or the other direction and you are in the heart of the Gothic quater with its tiny shutter lined streets, cool clothes shops and restaurants. There is a metro station about a five minute walk away at the top of Las Ramblas that takes you to all the major sights, so of course the location of the hotel is second to none, The best thing about this hotel is the fact that a) it looks so cool and gothic all throughout from the lobby, to the creaky old lift, to the reception and b) the service we recieved from all the staff was friendly and courteous (which I hate to admit you don't expect in busy European city hotels). I probably wouldnt recommend this hotel in the height of summer simply for the fact the rooms don't have minibars for water bottles, and personally if I want a summer holiday I like staying at beach resorts with a swimming pool but for sheer romance this hotel cannot be beaten if you want a culture packed, relaxing city-break.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel redefines bare minimum”
Reviews.Author: H00sier
Reviews.Content: If you want a bed in a good location at a moderately high price with little else added this is your hotel. The rooms have a bed (that's the good news). This is the only hotel I have ever stayed in that required a 20 Euro deposit to get a changer for the TV. Since there was only one English speaking channel, I really did not need a changer - but had to have it to get that one channel tuned in each time the TV was turned on. Everything from the complimentary toiletries to the furnishings in the room was as minimalistic as one could get. Usually when checking out, I am asked if we used anything from the mini bar (we never do) but they did not have to ask since there was none. Often we like to put a Coke or bottle of water in the mini refrigerator to keep it cool, but as I said they did not have one. There is a faint smell of sewer gas in the bathrooms. The reception staff was friendly with a couple of exceptions. Finally there were guests who returned to their rooms at 1-2 AM each night making sure that no one could continue to sleep . The walls are paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kazndave
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in four and five star hotels and werent expecting much but this quaint hotel exceeded our expectations. Came back from Barcelona yesterday (29 Jan 07) Hotel in Gothic style was extremely clean, the staff are friendly and helpful. Double room was small but who needs a big room when you're out all day. Spotlessly clean and warm. Everything we needed was there. Comfortable bed, nicely decorated. Bathroom excellent and also spotless with clean, soft towels Reception area undergoing some refurbishment but didnt cause any problems. The dining room and "lounge" could do with a face lift but again very clean and tidy. We would definitely stay there again . The location is superb with patisserie, restaurants and shops right outside. 20 yards from Las Ramblas - THE place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CorkRose
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Nouvel Hotel for one week at the beginning of September 06 and the only advantage of this hotel is its location situated just off La Rambla and near Placya de la Catalunya. The breakfast was pretty basic every morning with no variety to choose from. The reception room to the left of the entrance was depressing to look at and the decor in general badly needed to be upgraded. The bedroom had an antiquated portable TV which did not work. Whilst the room was small, it was clean and sheets and towels were changed every day. So my overall experience of this hotel was not great and I certainly would not recommend it. Eileen Twohig, Cork, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: euler
Reviews.Content: 10 girls stayed there for a 21st bday. We had two triple rooms and two twins, they were nice sizes. The baths in the twin room however were slightly short! The staff were friendly and the hotel was clean. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: dicemaid
Reviews.Content: We are two discerning 50 something ladies who have travelled extensively and we both felt that our 4 night stay at the Nouvel Hotel in Barcelona was one of our best trips! The location is outstanding for the price we paid - just £70 per room per night- as the Ave. St Anna is only 500 yards from the Placa de Catalunya and right in between Las Ramblas and the Ave De L'Angels so you are extremely well placed for all the hustle and bustle of the main drag but at the same time peaceful once inside this lovely Art Nouveau hotel. Our twin bedded (smoking) room on the 1st floor was enormous. The space between our beds and the dressing table was the size of an average dance floor! The bathroom was a decent size and the shower was mighty powerful. There was plenty of drawer space and a double wardrobe with a safe. Satellite TV was a bit limited for us, in that there was only CNN in English but apart from that, everything was just fine. We even had a decent sized balcony, though as it was winter we didn't spend much time on there! The breakfast was perfectly adequate with plenty of tea & coffee, bread for toasting, croissants, cheese,ham, yoghurts, cereals and fruits as well as hot scrambled eggs and sausages. Enough for all tastes we thought and open until a very civilized 10.30am. The reception staff were very welcoming, knowledgeable and user friendly. We would most certainly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Sewerage pipes”
Reviews.Author: RatPack
Reviews.Content: We have a large family room, which was much bigger than the other membesr of our party. However, the window opened intoa service elevator! There was no natural light in room and only two beside lights. We were in total gloom all weekend. ALso running down side of elevator shaft was sewerage pipe for hotel, so when anyone flushed a toilet at all it ran down the pipe at the back of our bed! This kept us awake a lot. On Sunday we noticed the bread rolls had mould on them. We were told by reception that that was all they had! You have to pay deposit for tv remote and generally the reception staff were not very friendly. Was recommended to a Flamenco Night. They obviously get a commission for selling the tickets. It cost €120 per couple, and the food was very dis-appointing, but not as dis-appointing as the dancing. Definitely not worth the money. The location of the hotel is great, however, but there are other hotels very close by with better accomodation and facilities. We would never go back or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: trekkertoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights at the end of Sept. The location, as others have mentioned, is excellent, as is the front desk staff. The room was rather basic, but clean, with an enclosed patio (we were on the top floor) that was plenty large enough for two couples to have tapas and wine. The A/C worked extremely well (and it was HOT in Barcelona while we were there). Beware: the beds are quite firm, so if you like them poufy, look elsewhere! I was surprised to read other reviews faulting the bathrooms. Ours was enormous (almost as large as the room!), and brand-new, with high-end fixtures and marble floor. The only real weakness was the breakfast, which was basic in the extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Nouvel Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FeeJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nouvel with 18 crazy chicks for a birthday Weekend. If you are going to Barcelona make sure you check its not Fiesta weekend.... Why? because all the shops are shut and there are about five times more people there, getting around was a nightmare!! Took the Bus from the Airport, Cheap and stops at the top of the Ramblas, The best thing about the Nouvel is the location, Just off the main Ramblas, down a quiet street, Its old but quite grand, lighting is very dingy in the rooms but they were clean and the shower was quite powerful, we had a room at the back of our hotel and our balcony over looked some strange courtyard, It was quite endearning to see Catalonian underpants hanging on washing lines, birds in cages and a sweet old couple shuffling about. The breakfast was ok, coffee and croissants were good but avoid the hot stuff, looked pretty sad and dried out to me, Reception staff were really helpful, especially Robert who tried to help me with the phone card I had bought, Dont buy one.. they dont work, you dial the number to activate it and its always engaged. theres a Supermarket on the Ramblas and you can buy a litre bottle of water for 39c. We only realised this after we had paid 5 Euros for two bottles! In the square is a fab cheap resturant, its just on the left hand side, the name translates to the 'Fifteen Nights' 3 course meal, drinks, coffees all for £14 squid each, Barg.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Full of Hen and Stag Partis”
Reviews.Author: jkcnwey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. It was basic but clean, Breakfast was basic but there was plenty of it. The main problem was that the hotel was very noisy. We could hear people in the rooms either side of us and walking around the lobbies. As the hotel was fairly reasonable there were a number of hen and Stag parties staying there therefore you can hear people coming in all night and talking in there rooms. I wouldnt stay here if you want a good nights sleep but itsgreat if your in a hen/stag party as there are plenty of people to talk too. Also the reception staff (except the old lady) were very useful and recommeded excellent bars/ restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, very central”
Reviews.Author: DPG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in June 2006. It is smaller type hotel, a few metres off the the Ramblas in a quiet side street. Our room was on the back of the hotel and was really quiet, a good size room with air con. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a little dissapointing, but OK. If we went to Barcelona again I would choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “muy muy dissapointing !”
Reviews.Author: rach2222
Reviews.Content: There are some good points to this hotel and some bad : The good are that the location was fab ! If you get the airport link bus it drops you off two minuets away ! it is right in the centre of the city so you can walk anywhere. It also has balconies on the room ours looked over the side street and was great for people watching, we even saw a parade from it ! The city is great must see segrada familia, casa balato and the cathedral v. near hotel( remeber to take a cover up for shoulders and legs) . Also the hard rock cafe is Great esp for teenagers who love music, though go in early as you have to wait for your table. Now on to the bad dun dun dun ! .... The Bathroom was nasty there were hairs from previous guests all over the floor, the mother did not like it! On our floor lobby, flowers were in a make shift vase a water bottle!! The hotel was very smoky also. it was dissapointing because the lobby ect looks great in the photos. Also there can be some noise from outside and the bin men come very early.Las ramblas can become nasty after a few days , the restarants that line it con you into litre glasses of drinks which cost a small fortune although they are fun before you realise the price. I recomend resaurants down sidestreets which have more charcter and are more relxed.I have also heard horror stories of bag stealers on las ramblas esp ppl who come on scooters and grab it , so keep a tight hold! ******On the plus though, on the street with the wax measuemum there is one of the best pubs in barcelona! It is themed like an enchanted forest with a running waterfall , trees oo it was soo much fun and very cool which was great in the heat - you shld go there it was fab ! ******* Also the waffles near the beach are good, also the market has great fruit which is good for a cheap lunch . Barcelona is a great city- enjoy yourself and I hope my opinions weren't completely usless.! adios

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: airbuster
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in June 06 and found the hotel very pleasant. We had a room for 3 people and found it spacious and clean. There was excellent choice for breakfast. The hotel is based in the middle of a small street which has small shops, cafes and restaurants. The location of the hotel is excellent. Right at the top of the Rambles is a great place for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: ClareEagles
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip to Barcelona, and stayed at Hotel Nouvel. Having read mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, I wasn't sure what I'd find! However, I can't really find any fault with the hotel. In terms of location, you couldn't ask for more. As this was my first visit to the city, I wanted to be in the heart of things, and just off the Las Ramblas was ideal. Ok, perhaps in some areas the hotel may need updating, but everything is kept very clean. I admit, we were lucky with our room, as we were at the back of the hotel. I didn't find it particularly noisy, and had 4 pleasant nights' sleep! But, as I say, it may have been different if I had a room at the front of the hotel. Yes, the room is basic - but these people who expect real luxury, aren't prepared to pay 5-star prices. The bathroom looked like it had recently been decorated, and new double-glazed windows were installed. All clean, and the maids were very pleasant. As for the staff at reception, I could not have asked for them to be more helpful and friendly. Any questions we had, they were always on hand to answer. The breakfast was good - with a full day's sight-seeing ahead, needed to fill myself up! Fruit, croissants, toast, rolls, jams, salami, ham, cheese, etc. Also, some hot food available, too. So, in conclusion, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent four days in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gaily1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days in Barcelona. We booked the hotel before checking Trip Advisor & were worried about the paper-thin walls etc mentioned in some of the reviews. Armed with earplugs just in case we arrived at the hotel and were met by very friendly staff. We had asked for a twin room when we booked just to give us more room, as we are not small people. The lady asked us if a double room was ok and foolishly we said yes. It was ok but the bad was very small, my partner is 6'3" so his legs and feet hung over at the bottom of the bed. The floor was not very clean as it had hairs from the previous occupant over the bathroom floor. They were cleaned up the next day. The view was not great as we were at the back so we overlooked another room, which was two meters away. Long corridors with hard surfaces create the noise, which amplifies the sound, other hotels guests slamming doors and shouting till the early hours were a problem until the earplugs went in! I never heard a thing after and slept like a baby possibly due to the amount of walking I did during the day. Most of the noise transfers from pipes and air conditioning units as they are all interlinked. We realised this when the guy next door was trying to open a bottle of beer on the radiator, at first we thought it was someone trying to send a Morse code message! The best thing in the room was the shower having read other reviews I was looking forward to it. The showerhead did not look too great but the water pressure was. The bedroom on the photo of the hotel is nothing like the bedroom we had, we later learnt that this is on the top floor, the hotel could do with updating all of it's bedrooms, however a quick glance into another room on the same floor showed us a twin room which was in much better condition than ours. The hotel was easy to find and it is just off Las Ramblas & in excellent location very close to all shops and easy walking distance to all areas. Corte Ingles (big department store which sells everything) is at one end of the street whilst Las Ramblas is at the other. Local transport is great, bus and tube are both very easy systems to understand & ticket machines are in several languages. I would go back to Barcelona as it is an excellent city and the people are very friendly especially if you speak a little Spanish which did help with the restaurant staff who did need to take a happy pill as one person said but were friendly enough once I spoke to them. Breakfast was also great with very fresh produce. I would also stay at the hotel again as overall it was adequate enough for the price and location but I would be more choosy about the room & would ask to see it in advance of accepting it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jess099
Reviews.Content: This is perfect spot to be staying in the hub of it all, yet down a traditional side street with plenty of atmosphere & not the huge bussle of the ramblas. We had a super trip, climbing the stairs in gaudi cathedral a must & some fantastic local tapas & 3 course meal restaurants down little streets in the gothic quarter. You need to explore by foot to discover the best restaurants. We also went to a beach out the city which was well worth it for a day of relaxing in the sun called, sitges. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: Great location, and value for money as well. Located very close to the Ramblas while being just far enough away to avoid the noise. Basic furnishings, but clean and pleasant. Some noise from the hallways due to tiled floors in the rooms and the hallways, it is impossible to avoid making a noise even if you try! Not recommended for anyone who wants to sleep late in the mornings! Good breakfast included in the rate, pleasant staff. Again, for location and value you cannot beat it. If you want luxury though, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights just before Christmas. Perfectly located in a good area just off Las Ramblas on the Gothic side near to Catalunya Square and the metro. Excellent for visiting the old city, the port and getting to anywhere in the centre and indeed anywhere else because of the proximity of the metro. Good accommodatrion with helpful and courteous staff, and absolutely no problems. We had a nice room with good bed and ensuite with balcony overlooking the narrow, atmospheric street where one could watch the world go by. Breakfast average. We didn't use the other facilities which looked fine in passing. Don't bring a car - nearby public parking costs a fortune. Good value, and what a location!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal For Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the hotel were excellent. We were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff who were keen to ensure that our stay in the hotel and Barcelona was as pleasant as possible. Our room was large, if basic, with a good standard of cleanliness. Due to the tiled floors the noise from corridors did tend to echo in our room however, this was not a particular problem that would put us off returning to the hotel in the future. The location is ideal for the tourist with limited time, very close to the centre but situated away from the noise of the main thoroughfare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macca58
Reviews.Content: Just got back and had a fantastic stay. The staff were excellent and the hotel was brilliantly situated for all the major sites. Go and enjoy yourself!!
